concept.title: Configuring messaging users and groups
concept.shortdesc: You can configure messaging users and groups either by using the or by using the user, and group commands on the command line.

p.note: You can configure messaging users and groups only if you are not using an external LDAP connection.

section.title: messaging users
section.p:
When you create messaging users, you must specify the following components:
User ID The name that identifies the messaging user. The name cannot contain leading or trailing spaces. The name must be unique. The name is not case sensitive.
Group Membership The messaging group that the user belongs to, if any. This group must exist before it can be associated with a user.
Password The password for the user. The password cannot contain leading or trailing spaces.

section.title: messaging groups
section.p:
When you create messaging groups, you must specify the following components:
Group ID The name that identifies the messaging group. The name cannot contain leading or trailing spaces. The name is not case sensitive.
Group Membership The group that the newly created group belongs to, if any. This group must exist before it can be associated with another group.
